turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: Typical profile, usually losers, nobodies that're afraid to confront their victims. They like scaring people. That's why they call in their threats. Same mentality as obscene phone callers.

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: Except they'll blow you up if you don't play along.

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: No, ninety-ninety percent of them are full of baloney. They're into the power trip, not the damage. What scares me is that this guy is so sophisticated he could blow up whatever he wants, then disappear. The worst of the bunch, they love the challenge of creating the wildest device ever... and they love the carnage.

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: This is where the van was parked.

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: Then, it's gotta be here somewhere ...

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: Nitro-cellulose. What is that, some kind of explosive?

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: Industrial wood oil. Separately, any one of these things could lead in several directions, but together ...

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: How long are we going to stay?

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: Not bad for Bomb squad, eh?

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: What not bad. You've got a series of bombs, devices, that may or may not be connected, set by one or many nutjobs, who may or may not be linked.

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: Well... it's more than we had ten minutes ago.

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: We've gotta be. In this business, you don't exactly make alot of outside commitments.

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: I don't know, it's strange... it's not the best career path, but when you get the bug, there's nothing you can do about it. See, when you beat one of these things...

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: One shuts it down, one turns arms it.

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: I don't know. There's an old saying, when in doubt, cut the yellow wire.

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: You don't have to talk about it.

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: Pittsburgh, two years ago. Partner died, no back-up, I was too gung-ho. As usual.

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: Take a tip from the Bomb Boys, always assess, if only for a second.

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: I know. I was working a drug ring, deep cover. Played the part too well. When they pulled me out, I wasn't a cop anymore. My fiance had dumped me. Next thing I knew, I was out here on the street, doped up, auditioning for the morgue when this tough old vice cop found me, cleaned me up, gave me a second chance. He promised Captain Winters he'd look out for me.

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: I guess I didn't realize how much I needed him. He kept me straight. It's been tough every second since.

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: No you're not, you just don't understand them. Here, do what I tell you.

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: Congratulations, you just built your first ticker.

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: Catch that alert? That's him in the U-Haul.

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: Cuz he got the girl, now he's leaving town.

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: Should we head for the Interstate?

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: No, I'd slip out past the hotel district, behind Greyhound...

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: Glass, Eighth Street, alley behind Grand Hotel. Cut him off.

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: C'mon, talk to me! We can do it!

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: He has a timer going as back-up, in case we got a hold of the remote.  Okay... first, run your fingers along the edges, feel for a sensor.

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: Close your eyes, feel your fingertips. Tell me everything you feel.

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: That's the blasting cap - good! Okay, now grab it by the base and pull it straight up. No, Wait...

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: Too easy. There's gotta be something else in there, another cap maybe.

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: Okay, one of the caps turns it on, the other shuts it down.

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: When in doubt, pull the yellow wire.

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: How the hell do you feel yellow?

turns.speaker: POOCH
turns.text: Assist? What the hell you know about tickers anyway?

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: Call upstairs, see what you can find out.

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: T.J., run a trace on this, see if you can pin down where it came from. Whoever these people are, let's hope they're all talk.

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: Hey, matches are a very big thing in our line of work.

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: Bev, give `em a call, find out what bowling alleys they supply in this area.

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: We work fast enough for you?

turns.speaker: POOCH
turns.text: Exactly my thinking. Except, none of the targets can actually be linked to government, political or special interest concerns. They seem to be just unrelated industrial companies. Some insured, some not.

turns.speaker: POOCH
turns.text: Nothing. Maybe they gave up, split town.

turns.speaker: T.J.
turns.text: No, we're terrorists, stay back or we'll blow.

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: We're a bit busy at the moment, I'll give you a statement in a few minutes if we're still alive.

turns.speaker: T.J.
turns.text: Yeah, he's helping us work up a profile on this thing.

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: Hope you don't mind, Captain, might help us catch these guys that much sooner.  Coming?

turns.speaker: T.J.
turns.text: We've lost brothers too, we know what that's like.

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: Let's get something straight. We're doing you a favor. You're not exactly a guy we want around explosives.

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: Unlikely. Probably, cash register or something.

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: I was wrong... this didn't come from any cash register.

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: Relax, Pooch, it's just a ticker, it's not personal.

turns.speaker: T.J.
turns.text: Let's face it, we all knew it would happen sooner or later. The guy who can build a mousetrap that's better than we are ...

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: Meg's lasagna. Good eats, Reilly. C'mon.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Cover.  It was suppose to be abandoned buildings, y'know. No one was suppose to get hurt. The night you busted us...We were checking to make sure there weren't any vagrants around. Scare them away.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Alex Swan. My brother. The other two are called Taylor and Leveau.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: There is a motel downtown, near the Machine Shop... the Suncrest. Room 138.

turns.speaker: SWAN
turns.text: We're moving' on. I have to pick up the supplies. Just two little boxes.

turns.speaker: PLUCHINSKY
turns.text: You're vice, not homicide. Besides, you don't have the experience and you're too personally involved.

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: Looks like the stuff my dad used to use to blow up tree stumps back in Scranton.

turns.speaker: PLUCHINSKY
turns.text: Maybe she knows your old man.

turns.speaker: PLUCHINSKY
turns.text: And what, you'll shoot me? Hey, don't mistake me for one of your partners, I'd like to make retirement in one piece.

turns.speaker: PLUCHINSKY
turns.text: You were lucky today, vice boy. Captain said to leave it alone, but just remember, I'm watching you.

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: I'm sorry, detective, but you're just not my type.

turns.speaker: PLUCHINSKY
turns.text: Lab's backed up, we're still waiting for it.

turns.speaker: PLUCHINSKY
turns.text: It's a bluff. The guy's full of crap.

turns.speaker: WINTERS
turns.text: We can't take the chance. Ring down to the Bomb Squad. I want them on alert.

turns.speaker: PLUCHINSKY
turns.text: Son-of-a-bitch... my nose... This fuck-up is interfering with-

turns.speaker: PLUCHINSKY
turns.text: I'm filing charges against that mother-

turns.speaker: WINTERS
turns.text: Can it, Pluchinsky. And shove some cotton up your nose.

turns.speaker: POOCH
turns.text: Nitro, dash of Semtrex, vegetable oil ...

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: What kind of bomb was it?

turns.speaker: POOCH
turns.text: Unsolved bombings in the last year... Boston, New York, Philadelphia... but no real match

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: Still waiting for a miracle. Go ahead.

turns.speaker: POOCH
turns.text: Time for bed, kiddos. Say goodnight.

turns.speaker: T.J.
turns.text: That guy's wife must be pretty pissed off to play a trick like that.

turns.speaker: POOCH
turns.text: No shit. I better send Meg flowers just in case.

turns.speaker: POOCH
turns.text: That'd be some explosive pussy he's got his hands on.

turns.speaker: POOCH
turns.text: Good boy, Schnoz. Daddy loves you.

turns.speaker: T.J.
turns.text: Scorch marks... looks like they used silly putty.

turns.speaker: T.J.
turns.text: Fuckin A, I think I got two partial prints here!

turns.speaker: POOCH
turns.text: Awright! How bout you, Glass, how's that chip shaking?

turns.speaker: T.J.
turns.text: That's one more time than any of the rest of us have seen it.

turns.speaker: RICE
turns.text: Know what the problem is, kid? You're too ugly to get propositioned.

turns.speaker: RICE
turns.text: Next week we work the park.

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: I gotta get back on top. Get off the sleaze detail.

turns.speaker: RICE
turns.text: You will, one day at a time. I'll be old and grey when it happens...

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: So what'll you do? After they give you the gold watch.

turns.speaker: RICE
turns.text: Hell, I got a gold watch... it just don't work. Maybe they'll give me a new fishing pole, or something useful.

turns.speaker: RICE
turns.text: How hard can it be? The grand kids been buggin' me about taking them camping.

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: You outta the city... that's a fish out of water. What's with all this family talk lately, anyway?

turns.speaker: RICE
turns.text: One of these days you're gonna get tired of fighting the shit. When that happens, you'll wish you had family.

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: No thanks. I got close but it never woulda worked.

turns.speaker: RICE
turns.text: Why don't you just shoot it and put it out of its misery?

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: What are you talking about, it's purring like a kitty.

turns.speaker: RICE
turns.text: I thought you said what's-her-name's brother was going to fix it.

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: She didn't work out, had to cut her loose.

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: She wanted to cook me breakfast.

turns.speaker: RICE
turns.text: We're vice, I didn't see no pimps or hookers in that van. But if you're so gung-ho, we'd best call it in for some back-up.

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: Nah, let's just take a look-see.

turns.speaker: RICE
turns.text: Take your time... one day at a time, kid...

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: Captain assigned me to assist you.

turns.speaker: T.J.
turns.text: Got it! Ace Match Company, Flint, Michigan.

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: You mean you just--? ... You keep a record of... matches?

turns.speaker: T.J.
turns.text: My first undercover assignment. I gotta look good, right?

turns.speaker: T.J.
turns.text: In this crowd? It's gonna be Marlboros, Camels, and maybe a few Kools.

turns.speaker: T.J.
turns.text: He's married, he don't even know what a lesbian is.

turns.speaker: WINTERS
turns.text: Reilly, what the hell happened out there? Why didn't you call for back-up?

turns.speaker: WINTERS
turns.text: Take it down to the Bomb Squad, Artie-

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: It's detonation cord, for a bomb.

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: Look, I saw these guys, I can i.d. them.

turns.speaker: WINTERS
turns.text: I know you're anxious to get back but... just stay out of homicide's way or I'll have you classifying fingerprints, understand?

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: Report on the case so far.

turns.speaker: WINTERS
turns.text: You know after a shooting I would normally take your badge and weapon, but Glass called in already and confirmed it was clean.

turns.speaker: WINTERS
turns.text: But from now on, any leads on this case go to Pluchinsky. He's primary investigator and you are unofficially assigned to the Bomb Squad... you and your new friends are not to be playing detective any more. Got it?

turns.speaker: WINTERS
turns.text: She's refused to say a word to anyone. What made you think you could get her to talk?

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: I didn't. But I had to try.
